#Text=Make South African White Pap
#Text=Maize

#Text=Meal is a relatively coarse flour ( much coarser than corn flour or cornstarch). . he Portuguese had originally brought corn or maize as it is known in Southern Africa from the Americas to Africa .
#Text=In the USA grits is the closets equivalent .
#Text=This food was originally eaten by the Voortrekkers during The Great Trek has become the diet staple of South Africa .
#Text=Because of its ability to be stored without refrigeration , it is cheap and abundant in all shops and markets .
#Text=It is also a food staple in Mozambique , Lesotho , Swaziland , Zambia , Zimbabwe , Malawi , Botswana and many other parts of Southern Africa .
#Text=Traditionally maize meal is made into uphuthu , sour-milk porridge , pap , and also Umqombothi ( a type of beer ) .
#Text=The raw ingredient of Maize meal is added to boiling water , the ratio of which produces either porridge or the firmer pap .
#Text=For a creamier dish , milk is added to produce porridge with a thick texture and is commonly eaten for breakfast in southern Africa .
#Text=The firmer pap is eaten with meat and gravy dishes as well as vegetables .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Begin with water in the pot .
#Text=The ingredients are : 4 cups Water ; 1 tsp Salt ; 1 cup Maize meal . *Please note that you can use the same ingredients for making pap and porridge .
#Text=Bring the water to a boil for Pap .
#Text=Set the temperature of your stove to 25 degrees C. Add salt to taste .
#Text=Add 3 cups of maize meal and stir with a wooden spoon/fork until thick and smooth .
#Text=Reduce the heat and simmer 30 minutes stirring occasionally ( 3 to 4 times ) , until the pap is thick , stiff and cooked through .
#Text=Serve the cooked Pap .
#Text=When cooked pap can be served with almost anything .
#Text=South Africans love it with different kinds of side dishes : Meat , Salads , Stews and with Milk .
#Text=Bring the water to a boil for Porridge .
#Text=Set the temperature of your stove to 25 degrees C. Add salt to taste .
#Text=In a bowl , mix maize meal with cold water .
#Text=Make sure it is smooth before pouring into the hot pot .
#Text=Pour and stir the maize meal into the boiling water .
#Text=Keep on on stirring until iti s well mixed .
#Text=Let it simmer for at 30 minutes with the lid on .
#Text=Add a spoon of butter and mix it up .
#Text=Serve the porridge with milk and sugar /honey .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Pap is an amazing staple food for the African people .
#Text=Most African homes serve pap on a daily basis .
#Text=It can be served with side dishes like meat , salads , different kinds of soups .
#Text=You can even serve it with famatted milk ( fermented milk i.e. yoghurt ? ) and sugar !
#Text=It has even modified it to cook in less time .
#Text=There are a lot of brands , but White Star is recommended .
#Text=Porridge is mostly for mornings .
#Text=Make sure when making , it is smooth .
#Text=You can either have white or brown porridge .
#Text=For flavor , you can add sugar and milk .
#Text=It is easy for kids to eat .
#Text=When cooking , kids should not be near the pot .
#Text=The maize meal pops while it is being poured into the pot .
#Text=So be careful .
